analysis.raw_analysis:
TRANSFORMATION TYPE: All tasks preserve grid size (input=output; ratio 1:1).

PATTERN THAT WORKS FOR ALL EXAMPLES: Each connected region of color 1 (the blue frame) that contains exactly one non-1 pixel has that pixel's color expanded to fill the black interior cells enclosed by that 1-region; the color-1 frame and other pixels remain.

KEY CHANGES:
- EX1: 1-frames unchanged; color 3, color 4 and color 2 each flood-fill their enclosing 1-region interiors.
- EX2: 1-frames unchanged; color 3 fills its top/central 1 interiors; color 2 fills the lower/other 1 interiors.
- EX3: 1-frames unchanged; color 4 fills top rooms, color 6 fills the large lower room, color 3 fills its enclosed interior.

=== INPUT-INPUT COMPARISONS ===
- All inputs have many disconnected connected regions of color 1. Each such 1-region is a hollow frame that contains exactly one non-1 pixel of some color (varies: 2,3,4,6,...). Frame shapes/positions differ; background is 0.

=== OUTPUT-OUTPUT COMPARISONS ===
- In every output each 1-frame is unchanged; every cell interior to that frame becomes the same single color equal to that frame's original lone inner pixel. Background 0 stays 0.

=== INPUT-OUTPUT COMPARISONS ===
- Rule: for each connected color-1 region, find its unique non-1 pixel color c and fill all interior 0 cells of that region with c (keep 1 border).

Reference objects: The blue connected regions (color 1) are stable—hollow frames that define interior cavities. They remain as borders and locate the target interiors.

Grid pattern: For every disconnected color-1 frame, flood-fill its enclosed interior with the color of the single non-1 seed pixel found inside that frame (propagate that seed to fill the cavity). Grid size and blue borders are preserved.

Objects: Key objects = hollow color-1 regions (frames) and the interior seed pixels (other colors). The seed determines the fill color; small 1-pixel connectors/bridges are structural but unchanged.

=== GENERAL RULE ===
Step 1: IF a set of cells form a connected region of color 1 (connected by 4-neighbors) THEN treat that connected region as a candidate hollow frame object.  
Step 2: IF a candidate 1-region (from Step 1) has at least one interior cell (a cell that is inside the closed boundary of the 1-region when considering the 1-region as a perimeter) THEN consider those interior cells as the cavity of that 1-region.  
Step 3: IF the cavity of a candidate 1-region contains exactly one cell whose color is not 1 and not 0 (i.e., exactly one non-1 seed pixel of some color C where C ∈ {2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9}) THEN record that seed color C for that 1-region.  
Step 4: IF a 1-region has a recorded seed color C (from Step 3) THEN change every cell in that 1-region's cavity that currently has color 0 to color C (i.e., flood-fill all interior 0 cells of that frame with color C).  
Step 5: IF a cell is part of any color-1 connected region (a border pixel) THEN leave that cell's color unchanged (do not alter any color-1 pixels).  
Step 6: IF a cell has color 0 and is not in the cavity of any color-1 region (i.e., background outside all frames) THEN leave that cell's color unchanged.  
Step 7: IF there are multiple color-1 connected regions in the grid THEN apply Steps 2–6 independently to each color-1 region (each frame is processed separately using its own single inner seed).

structured_analysis.general_rule:
Step 1: IF a set of cells form a connected region of color 1 (connected by 4-neighbors) THEN treat that connected region as a candidate hollow frame object.  
Step 2: IF a candidate 1-region (from Step 1) has at least one interior cell (a cell that is inside the closed boundary of the 1-region when considering the 1-region as a perimeter) THEN consider those interior cells as the cavity of that 1-region.  
Step 3: IF the cavity of a candidate 1-region contains exactly one cell whose color is not 1 and not 0 (i.e., exactly one non-1 seed pixel of some color C where C ∈ {2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9}) THEN record that seed color C for that 1-region.  
Step 4: IF a 1-region has a recorded seed color C (from Step 3) THEN change every cell in that 1-region's cavity that currently has color 0 to color C (i.e., flood-fill all interior 0 cells of that frame with color C).  
Step 5: IF a cell is part of any color-1 connected region (a border pixel) THEN leave that cell's color unchanged (do not alter any color-1 pixels).  
Step 6: IF a cell has color 0 and is not in the cavity of any color-1 region (i.e., background outside all frames) THEN leave that cell's color unchanged.  
Step 7: IF there are multiple color-1 connected regions in the grid THEN apply Steps 2–6 independently to each color-1 region (each frame is processed separately using its own single inner seed).
